profile_data.summary:
I’m never afraid to try something new. After building a strong foundation as a Java software developer, I channeled that knowledge in new ways: first I was a teacher, then I developed a software tool for veterinary schools, then I engineered software and applied Agile principles in the corporate world. I honed my leadership skills in Target’s Engineering Management Immersion Program. Now, with artificial intelligence and machine learning monopolizing the horizon, I’m learning to use data science to enhance the entire software engineering workflow.

MY CAREER STORY
Early in my career, I taught at a top-tier liberal arts college (Washington and Lee), but I learned that I’d rather be developing software instead of teaching students to do it. I joined the Bioinformatics Research Group, first at Virginia Tech and then at Iowa State, and engineered a software tool deployed at 5 of North America’s top veterinary schools. 

When that project’s funding ran out, I tried my hand in the corporate world as a software developer and Agile coach. I channeled my software skills into product management for a mobile device that utilizes augmented reality; we released on iOS, Android, HoloLens, Microsoft OS, and smart glasses. I completed Target’s Engineering Management Immersion Program, which honed my leadership skills – and helped me determine that I’m better suited to hands-on design and development than to a strictly management job. I can manage and/or coach others on the entire software development life cycle, from requirements gathering through deployment and upgrade.

MY NEXT ADVENTURE
I started studying machine learning in 2017 and have continued to pursue ML while launching and directing a team at Target to compile “small” engineering data, distill insights, and create visualizations with a GraphQL API. I now support other Target teams’ data science initiatives. As I continue to broaden my knowledge of machine learning, Google Cloud Platform, VertexAI, and Python, I strive to:

✵ Deliver automated, repeatable processes to enable data scientists to rapidly iterate on and deploy their models.  
✵ Expand my understanding of data science models, their construction, and their uses.
✵ Dive into the mathematical foundations underlying AI/ML models and use my math skills to make adjustments at the model level to optimize outcomes. 

ABOUT ME
When I’m not at work, you might find me bicycling, reading, or on my farm with my sheep, ducks, cats, and dogs. I love training my dogs to perform tricks, herd, and dance – yes, dance!
profile_data.headline: Lead Software Developer / Engineer ➠ Java Coding and Automation Specialist ✵ Incorporating machine learning and data science to develop robust MLOps framework, pipelines and models

experience.description:
Member of TargetML Platform Development Team
* Implement hybrid ML platform to enable data scientists to use consistent interface regardless of model experimenting, training and deployment location on-premises or on Google Cloud Platform and Vertex AI
* Develop Python SDK front-end and Spring-based Java back-end
* Use Terraform to enforce project-specific authorization
* Improve documentation and training materials to increase speed of on-boarding and delivery of value for data science teams
experience.title: Lead Engineer

experience.description:
Serve as the project and technical lead for application that collects and exposes data related to software development. Design and implement automation for data collection pipelines. 
➠ Develop proofs of concept to verify processes and designs. 
➠ Perform development and mentor team members in writing quality code. 
➠ Mentored new team members, ensuring their understanding of the product’s purpose and architecture; tested and reviewed code and assisted with problem solving. 
➠ Added product management responsibilities in 2023, combining software design with product roadmapping and planning user stories. 
➠ Engaged part-time in engineering support for other teams’ data science initiatives.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
✵ Supported a data science team in transitioning model training and execution from an on-premise data lake to Vertex AI, a Google Cloud machine learning platform. Used an existing SDK to create a Docker image to transfer data into VAI.
✵ Undertook leadership of a project to create a framework to facilitate machine learning model comparison.
✵ Led the Engineering Insights product development initiative (ongoing) to discover methods for accessing critical data and present insights and an accurate picture of processes and improvement opportunities.
✵ Architected, designed, and prototyped a microservices-based system to collect, process, and store data.
✵ Developed MVP for a GraphQL API front-end; monitoring and alerting systems; and mechanisms to query data, generate insights during post-processing, and transfer data to dashboards. 
✵ Automated daily data collection, processing, and updating processes with almost zero errors or downtime. 
✵ Implemented product usage dashboard; observed growth within user base while helping Target software remain stable, secure, and compliant with business requirements. 
✵ Co-led a presentation to explain the team’s function and value to a new leadership team.
experience.title: Lead Engineer

experience.description:
Completed an intensive leadership program for women with management potential; split time between training and functioning as a lead engineer for a digital security team of 8. 
➠ Provided leadership to the team that created tools to allow the cybersecurity team to shut down web traffic that was potentially insecure or might be limiting guests’ ability to view certain products. Products described below are still in use today.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
✵ Participated in design and development of a product that used Hadoop, Hive, and Spark to track browser fingerprints to distinguish bots from human purchasers. 
✵ Led a communication style discernment activity that improved team interactions and collaboration.
experience.title: eMIP Senior Engineering Manager

experience.description:
Functioned as product owner for the Vuforia View augmented reality app, managing product releases on iOS, Android, HoloLens, additional Microsoft operating systems, and emerging smart glass products. 
➠ Spearheaded new feature releases from idea to production. 
➠ Gathered feature requirements from product managers and salespeople and determined strategies, schedules, and milestones for incremental development and release. 
➠ Wrote detailed user and technical stories for software engineers. 
➠ Communicated status updates to stakeholders and interfaced with customers and sales representatives participating in beta testing. 
➠ Supported the customer success team in facilitating successful deployment and ongoing satisfaction. 
➠ Provided leadership and technical guidance to a development team of up to 9 developers, 3 QA specialists, and a UI designer, including FTEs in India and Israel and contractors in Poland, each dedicated to a single operating system (e.g. HoloLens/Windows, iOS, Android).

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
✵ Spearheaded development of the HoloLens app from proof of concept (POC) to production release in 6 months, enabling salespeople to demo a highly-sought-after solution in the industrial and maintenance environments. 
✵ Orchestrated the integration of the iOS ARKit framework into Vuforia View; released at the same time as iOS 11 to allow the sales team to capitalize on the buzz around iOS 11.
experience.title: Director, Product Management

experience.description:
Supervised and offered technical guidance to a team of 7 software developers and QA engineers focused on the iOS platform. Integrated a 7-person consulting team from Poland to develop Vuforia View first for Android, then for Windows. 
➠ Served as the team’s Agile coach: allocated resources to each project; led stand-ups, backlog grooming, and retrospectives; removed roadblocks to developers’ success; and drove continuous improvement of the development process. 
➠ Handled performance management and career development.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
✵ Supported the team in taking the Vuforia View iOS app from POC to production release in 6 months.
✵ Enabled broader sales of Vuforia View to include Windows-only customers.
experience.title: Software Development Manager
